Topic: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
CAN: The student can draw a simple shape representing an ice block or a raw egg, but details may be missing or inaccurate.
The student might include a basic drawing of water or a fried egg, but may not accurately connect these to the initial materials.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to clearly depict the process of change from ice to water or egg to cooked egg. (student may confuse or leave out transformation steps)
The student is unlikely to distinguish between reversible and irreversible changes with any clarity. (student may not understand concept of reversible vs. irreversible)
The student probably won't include any labels or captions, or may incorrectly label states or stages. (lack of understanding or knowledge of terminology)
The student may incorrectly depict water freezing back into ice or mistakingly show the cooked egg returning to its raw state. (possible misconception about reversibility)
